intro: Sorbus guanxianensis, commonly known as the Guanxian rowan, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and berries. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with serrated edges, and it produces yellowish-white flowers in spring. The berries, which are edible, turn red in autumn and are an important food source for birds and small mammals.
